channel.title: Microsoft Learn - in Intune
channel.description: The latest updates from Microsoft Learn in Intune

item.title: Create assignment filters in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Create assignment filters in Microsoft Intune to target policies based on device properties like OS version or manufacturer. Learn to create, update, and delete filters for managed devices and apps.

item.title: Set up local admin account creation and password management for macOS devices - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Set up macOS account configuration with LAPS through automatic device enrollment for macOS devices in Intune.

item.title: Set up account driven Apple User Enrollment - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Set up account driven Apple User Enrollment for personal devices enrolling in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Set up enrollment for macOS devices - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Set up enrollment for macOS devices in Intune.

item.title: Assign Apps to Groups in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to assign an Intune app to groups of users or devices using Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Deployment guide to manage macOS devices in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn the recommended processes to manage macOS devices in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Shared iPad devices - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn about Shared iPad devices.

item.title: Use Microsoft Intune to manage software updates for supervised iOS/iPadOS devices - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Use Microsoft Intune to manage system updates for supervised iOS/iPadOS devices.

item.title: Create a Wi-Fi profile for devices in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: See the steps to create a Wi-Fi device configuration profile in Microsoft Intune. Create profiles for Android device administrator, Android Enterprise, Android kiosk, iOS, iPadOS, macOS, Windows 10/11, and Windows Holographic for Business. Use these profiles to create a WiFi connection to use certificates, choose an EAP type, select an authentication method, enable a proxy, and more.

item.title: Deployment guide to manage iOS/iPadOS devices in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: A guide to managing iOS/iPadOS devices in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Single sign-on (SSO) for iOS/iPadOS and macOS - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Overview of Microsoft Enterprise SSO plug-in in Microsoft Intune, Jamf Pro, and other MDM solution providers. The Enterprise SSO plug-in is available on iOS/iPadOS and macOS devices.

item.title: Add Web Apps to Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn about adding web apps (client-server applications) to Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Restrict devices features using policy in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Add a device configuration profile to restrict features on Android device administrator, Android Enterprise, AOSP, macOS, iOS, iPadOS, and Windows 10/11 client devices in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Device features and settings in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Overview of the different Microsoft Intune device profiles. Get info on GPO, features, restrictions, email, wifi, VPN, education, certificates, upgrade Windows 10/11, BitLocker and Microsoft Defender, and custom device configuration settings in the Microsoft Intune admin center. Use these profiles to manage and protect data and devices in your company.

item.title: Overview of Apple device enrollment in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Utilize Apple device enrollment to enroll and manage user-owned iOS/iPadOS devices in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Add VPN settings to devices in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: On Android device administrator, Android Enterprise, iOS, iPadOS, macOS, and Windows devices, use built-in settings to create virtual private network (VPN) connections in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Shared iOS and iPadOS devices - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn about Shared iOS and iPadOS devices.

item.title: Set up per-app VPN for iOS/iPadOS devices in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: See the prerequisites, create a group for the virtual private network (VPN) users, add a SCEP certificate profile, configure a per-app VPN profile, and assign some apps to the VPN profile in Microsoft Intune on iOS/iPadOS devices. Also lists the steps to verify the VPN connection on the device.

item.title: Kiosk settings for Windows and Holographic devices in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Configure your Windows 10/11 and Windows Holographic for Business devices as single-app and multi-app kiosks, customize the start menu, add apps, show the task bar, and configure a web browser in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Get started with macOS endpoints - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Microsoft Intune guide to set up and configure macOS devices from setup to creating policies and enrolling devices. You secure your corporate and organization-owned endpoints that are enrolled in Intune, and then deploy at scale with Apple Business Manager or Apple School Manager.

item.title: Set up user enrollment with Company Portal for iOS - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Set up the profile based Apple User Enrollment option for personal devices enrolling in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Use custom device settings in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Add or create a profile to use custom settings for Windows 10/11 client, Android device administrator, Android Enterprise, macOS, and iOS/iPadOS devices using Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Create iOS/iPadOS or macOS device profile with Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Add or create an iOS, iPadOS, or macOS device profile. Configure settings for AirPrint, layout of the home screen, app notifications, shared device, single sign-on, and web content filter settings in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Use derived credentials for mobile devices with Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Use a third-party partners derived credential as an authentication method for Intune.

item.title: Configure security, email, VPN, and Wi-Fi device configuration profiles - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Step 4 to deploy device configuration profiles as part of the minimum set of policies for your devices using Microsoft Intune. The starting point is to enable the firewall, install AV, scan for malware, install software updates, create a strong PIN policy, and create email, VPN, and Wi-Fi device configuration profiles.

item.title: Get started with iOS/iPadOS frontline worker devices - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to manage frontline worker devices using iOS and iPadOS devices in Microsoft Intune. Select the best enrollment option, configure the home screen, and more.

item.title: Add custom settings to Apple devices in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Export iOS, iPadOS, and macOS settings from Apple Configurator or Apple Profile Manager tools, and then import these settings into Microsoft Intune. These settings can create, use, and control custom settings and features on iOS, iPadOS, and macOS devices. This custom profile can then be assigned or distributed to iOS, iPadOS, and macOS devices in your organization to create a baseline or standard.

item.title: Install the Microsoft Tunnel VPN for Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Install and configure Microsoft Tunnel Gateway on a Linux server to support Intune managed cloud-based devices in connecting to your on-premises infrastructure.

item.title: Configure WiFi settings for Apple devices in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Add or create a Wi-Fi configuration profile on iOS/iPadOS and macOS devices using Wi-Fi configuration settings in Microsoft Intune. Configure the connection details, authentication methods, SSIDs, security types, and proxy settings.

item.title: Settings insight - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Settings insight provides peer benchmarking information during security baseline configuration, showing when organizations similar to yours use Microsoft's recommended default values.

item.title: Turn on iOS/iPadOS supervised mode with Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to turn on iOS/iPadOS supervised mode with Intune.

item.title: Overview of Apple User Enrollment in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Utilize Apple User Enrollment to enroll and manage user-owned iOS/iPadOS devices in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Configure VPN settings for Apple devices in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Add or create a VPN configuration profile on iOS/iPadOS and macOS devices using virtual private network (VPN) configuration settings in Microsoft Intune. Configure the connection details, authentication methods, split tunneling, custom VPN settings with the identifier, key and value pairs, per-app VPN settings that include Safari URLs, and on-demand VPNs with SSIDs or DNS search domains, proxy settings to include a configuration script, IP or FQDN address, and TCP port.

item.title: Assign device profiles in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Use the Microsoft Intune admin center to assign device configuration profiles and policies to users and devices. Learn how to exclude groups from a profile assignment in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Microsoft Intune documentation - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn more about managing devices, apps, and security with Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Learn about using Intune to manage Microsoft Defender settings on devices that aren't enrolled with Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to use Intune policy to manage Microsoft Defender security settings on devices that aren't enrolled with Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Configure Update Policies for Apple Devices - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to configure software update policies for Apple devices using Apple's Declarative Device Management (DDM) model. Improve security, reduce user disruption, and ensure compliance with reliable, automated updates across your organization.

item.title: Get support in the Microsoft Intune admin center - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Get online and telephone support for Microsoft Intune and other device management cloud services from within the Microsoft Intune admin center.

item.title: Endpoint management services and solutions at Microsoft - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Microsoft Intune is a family of on-premises products and cloud services. It includes Intune, Configuration Manager, co-management, Endpoint Analytics, Windows Autopilot, and the admin center to manage cloud devices and on on-premises.

item.title: Add, Configure, and Protect Apps with Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Add, configure, and protect apps with Intune.

item.title: Help Desk Troubleshooting Dashboard - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Help desk staff use the troubleshooting pane to solve users' technical problems.

item.title: Configure Windows Feature Update Policies - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn about Windows feature update polies and how to manage them in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Collect device hardware info with the properties catalog - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Use the properties catalog in Microsoft Intune view and collect enhanced device hardware info on Windows devices you manage with Intune. You can collect info like BIOS version, TPM status, disk info, memory details, and network adapter configurations. Use this information to get deeper visibility into your device inventory and troubleshoot issues.

item.title: Prepare a Win32 App to Be Uploaded to Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to prepare a Win32 app to be uploaded to Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Add and Assign Win32 Apps to Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to add, assign, and manage Win32 apps with Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Win32 App Management in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to manage Win32 apps with Microsoft Intune. This article provides an overview of the Intune Win32 app delivery and management capabilities.

item.title: Upgrade the Microsoft Tunnel Gateway server software - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Understand how Microsoft Tunnel Gateway upgrades to new versions of the tunnel software for Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Network endpoints for Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Review endpoints for Intune. This page lists IP addresses and port settings needed for proxy settings in your Intune deployments.

item.title: Microsoft Intune built-in roles reference - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Permissions reference for built-in roles for Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Create a custom role in Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to create a custom role in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Assign a role to an Intune administrator - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to assign a built-in or custom role to a user in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Role-based access control (RBAC) with Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how RBAC lets you control who can perform actions and make changes in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Enable use of Windows diagnostic data by Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Enable Windows diagnostic data in processor configuration for your tenant to enable its use by Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Manage Windows Update Ring Policies - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn about Windows Update ring policies for Windows devices, how to create and manage them, and improve update deployment.

item.title: Manage Windows Feature Updates - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to use Microsoft Intune policies to manage Windows feature updates.

item.title: Microsoft Intune Government Service overview - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn more about the Intune government service offerings and features. This article is designed to serve as an overview of the Microsoft Intune offering for government community cloud (GCC) High and United States Department of Defense (DoD) environments.

item.title: Use Compatibility Reports for Windows Updates in Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Use the app and driver compatibility reports for Windows devices before you deploy Intune policies for feature updates or update rings.

item.title: Use Microsoft Intune policies to manage macOS software updates - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Use Microsoft Intune to manage system updates for supervised macOS devices.

item.title: Android FOTA Updates - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Use Microsoft Intune to manage firmware updates on Android devices. A FOTA update can include software and security patches, feature updates, and other changes to the device's firmware.

item.title: Configure Rollout Options for Feature Update Policies - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Configure rollout options in feature update policies to control when Windows feature updates become available to devices and deploy updates gradually.

item.title: Protect devices with Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn about the Intune capabilities that can help you protect your devices and data against unauthorized access and other threats.

item.title: Admin checklist for iOS/iPadOS software updates in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Guidance and advice for administrators that create and manage software updated for iOS/iPadOS devices using Microsoft Intune. See sample policy for different industry scenarios, including shared devices, kiosk, manufacturing, and information worker.

item.title: Admin checklist for Android software updates in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Guidance and advice for administrators that create and manage software updated for Android devices using Microsoft Intune. See tasks and settings that can manage updates on corporate owned Android Enterprise devices.

item.title: Admin guide and checklist for macOS software updates - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Guidance and advice for administrators that create and manage software updates for macOS devices using Microsoft Intune. Use this article to help manage software updates on your organization-owned devices, including how to create policies, manage updates, and review update status.

item.title: Tutorial-Get started with cloud-native Windows endpoints - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Set up secure cloud-native Windows endpoints that are Microsoft Entra joined, enrolled in Intune, and then deploy at scale with Windows Autopilot.

item.title: Admin checklist for software updates on BYOD in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Guidance and advice for administrators that create and manage software updated for BYOD and personally owned devices using Microsoft Intune. See tasks and settings that can manage updates on personal devices on Android and iOS/iPadOS platforms.

item.title: Manage Windows quality updates - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to manage Windows quality updates in Microsoft Intune using quality update policies, expedited updates, and hotpatch to keep devices secure and compliant.

item.title: Update your workloads to support cloud-native endpoints - Microsoft Intune
item.description: To support hybrid and remote workers, convert or migrate your workloads to support cloud-native endpoints. This planning guide focuses on deploying apps and updates with Intune, moving from Group Policy Objects, and using Windows Autopilot.

item.title: Use the Vulnerability Remediation Agent to Manage Vulnerabilities - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to use the Vulnerability Remediation Agent in Microsoft Intune to identify, prioritize, and remediate security vulnerabilities across your managed devices.

item.title: Windows cloud configuration step by step guide - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Use this Windows 10/11 cloud configuration step-by-step setup guide to create your own cloud configuration deployment. You create the Microsoft Entra group and policies using Microsoft Intune, including the enrollment profile, compliance policy, and security baseline. You also deploy apps and resources that users need to do their jobs.

item.title: Update Rings Policy Settings - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Reference article that lists all the settings for Windows Update rings.

item.title: View Software Update Reports for Apple Devices - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Track Apple device update status in real time with Intune's declarative software update reporting. Learn how Microsoft Intune surfaces update changes directly from managed Apple devices.

item.title: Windows Update Management Overview - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to manage Windows updates with Intune. Control update settings, define rollout strategies, and ensure consistent device security across your organization.

item.title: Reports for Windows Feature Update Policies - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn about the reports available for Windows feature update policies in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Expedite Policies for Windows Quality Updates - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to use expedite policies in Microsoft Intune to quickly deploy a specific Windows security update, bypass deferrals, and monitor installation status across devices.

item.title: Configure Windows Driver Update Policies - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to create, approve, deploy, and pause Windows driver updates using Intune policies to keep Windows devices current and stable.

item.title: Manage Windows Driver Updates - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to manage Windows driver updates using Intune driver update policies to keep Windows devices current and stable.

item.title: Software Update Errors and Descriptions - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Reference article with a list of the Software Update agent error code in Microsoft Intune, including the symbolic name and error description.

item.title: Use Windows Holographic devices with Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Use Microsoft Intune to manage and complete different tasks on devices running Windows Holographic for Business and HoloLens. You can configure the Company Portal app, create a compliance policy, customize OMA-URI settings, deploy apps, categorize devices in groups, create profiles, restrict devices, enable software updates, set terms and conditions, configure VPN and Wi-Fi settings, and use Hello for Business.

item.title: Use Hotpatch With Windows Quality Updates - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how hotpatch works with Windows quality update policies in Microsoft Intune to install eligible security updates without requiring an immediate device restart.

item.title: Reports for Windows Quality Update Policies - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn about the reports available for Windows quality update policies in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Reports for Windows Driver Update Policies reports - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to use Intune reports to monitor Windows driver updates for devices assigned to Windows Driver update policies.

item.title: Upgrade Devices to Windows 11 Using Feature Updates - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to upgrade Windows 10 devices to Windows 11 using feature updates in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Frequently Asked Questions About Windows Driver Update Policies - Microsoft Intune
item.description: This article provides answers to some frequently asked questions about Windows Driver Update Policies.

item.title: Reports for Windows Update Ring Policies - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn about the reports available for Windows update ring policies in Intune. Discover how to access and interpret these reports to monitor update deployments.

item.title: Microsoft Intune Service Description - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Microsoft Intune is a cloud-based service that helps you manage Windows, iOS/iPadOS, macOS, and Android devices.

item.title: Zebra LifeGuard Over-the-Air Integration with Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Use Microsoft Intune to manage firmware updates for supported Zebra devices.

item.title: Custom settings - Windows Holographic for Business devices - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Add or create a custom profile to use the OMA-URI settings for devices running Windows Holographic for Business in Microsoft Intune, including Microsoft HoloLens. You can set AllowFastReconnect, AllowVPN, AllowUpdateService, UpdateServiceURL, RequireUpdatesApproval, ApprovedUpdates, and ApplicationLaunchRestrictions policy configuration service provider (CSP) settings.

item.title: Operating systems and browsers supported by Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Lists supported device platforms and browsers for Intune device management

item.title: Planning guide to move to Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Plan, design, implement, adopt, and move to Microsoft Intune. Get guidance and advice to determine goals, use-case scenarios and requirements, and create rollout and communication plans, support, testing, and validation plans.

item.title: Migration guide to Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Deployment guide to set up, onboard, or move to Intune. These steps include moving from partner MDM providers, using co-management, moving from on-premises group policy, and moving from Office 365 device management.

item.title: Get started with Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: See an overview of the steps to start using Intune. Plan your move and deployment of Intune, determine your licensing needs and any platform requirements, use compliance and Conditional Access, deploy apps, create device configuration profiles, and enroll your devices to be managed. Get more information on mobile application management for BYOD or personal devices.

item.title: What is device management? - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn more about what device management means and how it can help organizations, including Microsoft 365 small & medium business, and enterprise. See a list of features and benefits, including mobile device management (MDM) and mobile application management (MAM), and learn about Microsoft Intune.

item.title: View device details with Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: View your device details, including operating systems, storage space, manufacturer, and model. Get a list of installed apps, check compliance policies, and set up TeamViewer with Microsoft Intune in Azure. Similar to viewing inventory of the devices you manage.

item.title: Deployment guide to manage Android devices in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn the recommended processes to manage Android devices in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Using Windows virtual machines with Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: This article describes the general guidelines for using Windows 10/11 virtual machines with Microsoft Intune

item.title: Add users to Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to add and managing Microsoft Entra user accounts from within Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Deployment guide for Linux device management - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Use our platform deployment guide to set up Linux device management in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Deployment guide for Windows device management - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Use our platform deployment guide to set up Windows device management in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Microsoft Intune servicing information and details - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn more about the frequency of the Microsoft Intune service updates, the release cadence, and how to check your tenant release version.
